definitions.definition: every thing, person, etc. in a group of two or more, considered separately:
examples: When you run, each foot leaves the ground before the other comes down.

definitions.definition: used to say that everyone likes different things:
examples: You actually like modern jazz, do you? Each to their own.

definitions.definition: If you put an amount of money each way on a horse race, you will win money if the horse you have chosen comes first, second, or third.
